technologies.name: Skolengo
technologies.description: Skolengo is an Education Management Software developed by Kosmos Education.

technologies.description: Fourthwall helps to create and launch a branded website.

technologies.name: Magento
technologies.description: Magento is an open-source ecommerce platform written in PHP.

technologies.name: TYPO3 CMS
technologies.description: TYPO3 is a free and open-source Web content management system written in PHP.

technologies.name: Sentry
technologies.description: Sentry is an open-source platform for workflow productivity, aggregating errors from across the stack in real time.

technologies.name: MariaDB
technologies.description: MariaDB is an open-source relational database management system compatible with MySQL.

technologies.name: Java
technologies.description: Java is a class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language used for web development.

technologies.name: Node.js
technologies.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

technologies.name: Apache Tomcat
technologies.description: Apache Tomcat is an open-source implementation of the Java Servlet, JavaServer Pages, Java Expression Language and WebSocket technologies.

technologies.name: React
technologies.description: React is an open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces or UI components.

technologies.name: Google Cloud
technologies.description: Google Cloud is a suite of cloud computing services.

technologies.name: styled-components
technologies.description: Styled components is a CSS-in-JS styling framework that uses tagged template literals in JavaScript.

technologies.name: Express
technologies.description: Express is a web application framework for Node.js, released as free and open-source software under the MIT License. It is designed for building web applications and APIs.

technologies.name: core-js
technologies.description: core-js is a modular standard library for JavaScript, with polyfills for cutting-edge ECMAScript features.

technologies.name: Appsflyer
technologies.description: AppsFlyer is a SaaS mobile marketing analytics and attribution platform.

technologies.name: Google Cloud Trace
technologies.description: Google Cloud Trace is a distributed tracing system that collects latency data from applications and displays it in the Google Cloud Console.

technologies.name: Google Cloud CDN
technologies.description: Cloud CDN uses Google's global edge network to serve content closer to users.

technologies.name: Zendesk
technologies.description: Zendesk is a cloud-based help desk management solution offering customizable tools to build customer service portal, knowledge base and online communities.

technologies.name: Sendinblue
technologies.description: Sendinblue is an email marketing solution for small and medium-sized businesses that want to send and automate email marketing campaigns.

technologies.name: Google Workspace
technologies.description: Google Workspace, formerly G Suite, is a collection of cloud computing, productivity and collaboration tools.

technologies.name: PWA
technologies.description: Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) are web apps built and enhanced with modern APIs to deliver enhanced capabilities, reliability, and installability while reaching anyone, anywhere, on any device, all with a single codebase.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.

technologies.name: HTTP/3
technologies.description: HTTP/3 is the third major version of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol used to exchange information on the World Wide Web.

technologies.name: Google Cloud Storage
technologies.description: Google Cloud Storage allows world-wide storage and retrieval of any amount of data at any time.

technologies.name: DocuSign
technologies.description: DocuSign allows organisations to manage electronic agreements.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

seo.title: SEO
seo.description: These checks ensure that your page is following basic search engine optimization advice. There are many additional factors Lighthouse does not score here that may affect your search ranking, including performance on [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/learn-web-vitals/). [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
seo.manualDescription: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.

pwa.title: PWA
pwa.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).
pwa.manualDescription: These checks are required by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist) but are not automatically checked by Lighthouse. They do not affect your score but it's important that you verify them manually.
